page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY - DUNURE
page.content: Popular walks are Drover's Road 18th Century nicknamed Old Roman Road also disused single track coastal railway. Mary Queen of Scots visited Dunure Castle 5th/7th August 1563.In 1570 Allan Stewart Commandator of Cross raguel Abbey was roasted in the Black Vault by Gilbert Kennedy who coveted the Abbey Lands.Broken coast line and caves meant smuggling was rife in Burns' time.Recently these were homes for tramps and hermits.Shipwrecks 11th Dec.1883 Millrhu Point Danish ship Valkyrian and steam tug Iron Duke. Local heroes rescued all but one of the crews of these two ships. Dunure lying between Turnberry practise air strip and Prestwick which controlled the Western Approaches has a small war graves 1939-45 area in its cemetery.
